text: the 2008 Summer Olympic Games an English
lesson for the advanced student part 1
vocabulary skills task 3 words and
context listen to Jennifer talk about
the 2008 Summer Olympic Games pay
attention to the use of the vocabulary
words
this month millions of people around the
world turned their attention to Beijing
China and watch the 2008 Summer Olympic
Games there were many memorable moments
for the athletes but to be honest the
event that made the strongest impression
on me was the opening ceremony
I think the creators of the show knew
even before August 8th that they have
created a spectacular event that the
world would talk about for generations
to come
the fact is that China with its
exhaustive use of resources and high
level of organization has raised the bar
for all other host cities in the future
on August 8th thousands of lucky people
crowded into the Beijing National
Stadium the bird's nest and watched the
largest and most expensive opening
ceremony ever everyone knows that China
has the largest population in the world
and the opening ceremony reflected this
it was simply breathtaking to see over
15,000 people perform together with such
artistry and skill no one in the stadium
are watching at home had ever seen a
combination of Technology and artistry
on this scale 2008 drummers with drums
that live up
a large LED paper scroll that appeared
to unroll over the stadium floor
dozens of dancers in exquisite costumes
these were just a handful of the many
ideas that a Chinese filmmaker dreamed
up one thing is for sure London has a
tough act to follow in the 2012 Olympic
Games
everyone will compare the opening
ceremony to the one they saw in Beijing
China tasks for common expressions guess
the meaning of the expression raise the
bar the fact is that China with its
exhaustive use of resources and high
level of organization has raised the bar
for all other host cities in the future
raise the bar means a create problems or
difficulties be set higher expectations
or standards or C give warnings the best
answer is B if you look at the picture
you see a high jumper trying to get over
the bar if you raise that bar you expect
more from that jumper so raising the bar
in sports business academics or other
situations means setting higher
standards you expect more a tough act to
follow one thing is for sure London has
a tough act to follow as the host city
of the 2012 Olympic Games a tough act to
follow means a an unwillingness to
follow rules be a performance that is
not easily matched in skill or quality
or see a group of people who are not
skilled the answer is B ask yourself
this in a competition if you had to
perform on stage would you want to
follow immediately after someone else's
excellent performance task 5 other word
forms read the sentence and identify the
part of speech of the bold-faced word in
other words decide if it's a noun verb
or adjective
one the crowd was excited and happy here
crowd is a noun to Sydney Australia
hosted the 2000 Olympic Games hosted is
a verb the skill of the young diver
impressed me greatly impressed is a verb
for Michael Phelps has an impressive
record as an Olympic swimmer he has won
14 gold medals impressive is an
adjective
5 the amazing fireworks were a
reflection of China's technology
reflection is a noun
task 6 using the words answer the
questions if you're studying by yourself
you can write down your answers if
you're studying with a partner take
turns answering the questions 1 do you
think it's easier to jump over a high
bar or go under a low bar to name a
memorable moment in sports 3 give an
example in sports when exquisite
artistry combines with physical strength
for as your hometown ever hosted a major
sporting event 5 in sports to success
come more through talent or exhaustive
efforts 6 which Olympic event is the
most impressive to watch 7 is there a
sport that reflects the nature of the
people in your country 8 have you ever
seen a spectacular performance by an
athlete or a group of athletes
9 which sport or sports requires the
most financial resources in your country
10 what do you think is the toughest
sport to master 11 how can the police
manage crowds of very happy or very
angry sports fans 12 complete the
statement I am a big fan of it would be
breathtaking to meet this athlete one
day end of part 1 please go on to the
next part of this lesson
